Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) for ETL development.
Strong experience with SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) for data modeling.
Hands-on expertise in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for report generation.
Solid experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience in working with large datasets and optimizing queries for performance.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).
Experience with Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Controller de Gestão de Projetos | Porto
HTML:
A Pinto & Cruz Gestão, empresa do Grupo Pinto & Cruz, de serviços partilhados. Atualmente, estamos a contratar um/a Controller de Gestão de Projetos para integrar a nossa equipa de Controlo de Gestão do Grupo e que estará em contacto direto com os Diretores de Obra e Responsáveis de Negócio, na nossa sede no Porto.

FUNÇÃO

Terás como principais responsabilidades:

  • Elaboração e controlo do fluxo de procedimentos associados aos projetos;
  • Monitorização do cronograma financeiro (orçamentos, encomendas, faturação, etc.);
  • Acompanhamento e análise de custos, desvios e rentabilização dos projetos;
  • Controlo e execução financeira, de forma a assegurar o cumprimento de prazos de pagamentos e recebimentos;
  • Gestão e supervisionamento da logística de materiais e dos equipamentos dos projetos;
  • Garantia do aprovisionamento atempado e eficiente de recursos;
  • Coordenação das equipas internas e de fornecedores para maximizar a rentabilidade anexa aos projetos;
  • Fornecimento de relatórios de acompanhamento e apoio à tomada de decisão da direção dos projetos;
  • Implementação de processos de controlo de custos e de eficiência operacional;
  • Garantia de conformidade com normas e procedimentos internos.


PERFIL

Tens boa capacidade de comunicação e relacionamento interpessoal? Valorizas o rigor, a organização e o pensamento crítico? Se sim, esta oportunidade pode ser para ti!

  • Licenciatura em contabilidade, gestão ou área similar (obrigatório);
  • Experiência em funções semelhantes (preferencial);
  • Conhecimentos de controlo financeiro, análise de custos e logística de obra (preferencial);
  • Domínio de ferramentas informáticas, com preferência por Excel e Primavera (obrigatório);
  • Disponibilidade imediata (preferencial).


CONDIÇÕES

  • Remuneração de acordo com a experiência e conhecimentos demonstrados;
  • Pacote de compensações;
  • Possibilidade de trabalho remoto a médio prazo;
  • Integração em equipa com um ambiente colaborativo;
  • Integração num grupo empresarial sólido e prestigiado;
  • Oportunidades de desenvolvimento pessoal e formação na área de atuação;
  • Horário de 2ª a 6ª feira, das 8h45 ao 12h30 e das 13h45 às 18h00.


Se esta vaga te interessa, envia-nos o teu currículo e junta-te a nós!

Title: Assistente de suporte técnico
HTML:
A Synchro

by Egor, Outsourcing, recruta Assistente de Apoio Técnico (área médica), para colaboração com Organismo Público localizado no Porto.

FUNÇÃO

A função a desempenhar implica tarefas ao nível de atendimento telefónico e suporte ocupacional a Instituições do Ministério da Saúde.

Atendimento Telefónico

  • Assegurar as chamadas, inbound e outbound, referentes a questões de âmbito técnico e de negócio na área da saúde;
  • Registo de chamadas em plataforma do cliente para o efeito;

Suporte Aplicacional

  • Aceder a plataforma de ITSM (Ticketing) do cliente, para tratamento de eventos, incidentes e pedidos de serviço;
  • Fazer a correta catalogação dos temas;
  • Realizar a análise dos temas reportados e se necessário encaminhar para outras linhas de suporte.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Turnos de 8 horas no regime 24×7;
  • Local de trabalho: Porto.

REQUISITOS

  • Habilitações mínimas: 12º ano completo;
  • Experiência comprovada em suporte aplicacional (obrigatório);
  • Experiência em Suporte telefónico aos sistemas do ministério da saúde;
  • Experiência em Suporte aplicacional na área da saúde em ambiente privado, hospitalar e de cuidados de saúde primários;
  • Experiência e disponibilidade para realizar turnos em regime 24×7.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Contrato de trabalho com condições ajustadas à função;
  • Integração em projeto de elevada responsabilidade.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

Synchro by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis.

Title: Rececionista de Oficina (M/F) – Porto - 115/2025
Description:
Descrição da Função

A inovação na oferta dos serviços e a criação de valor na relação com os Clientes são prioridade do GRUPO MCOUTINHO. Suportamos a nossa ambição na experiência de 68 anos no retalho automóvel. Faz parte de uma Equipa com mais de 1.300 colaboradores, onde o talento e a partilha de experiências constituem o nosso ADN. Contribui com a tua criatividade e irreverência para a construção do futuro da mobilidade. Para reforço da equipa de Após-Venda no Porto, terás como principais desafios: - Atendimento e acompanhamento de clientes Após-Venda; - Gestão das entradas na oficina; - Esclarecimento acerca das intervenções auto, dos seus custos e prazos de entrega das viaturas; - Gerir o processo de follow-up e entrega de viaturas junto do cliente; - Realização de tarefas administrativas inerentes à função. Se o teu perfil combina com os nossos requisitos, participa: - Formação ao nível do 12º Ano; - Experiência profissional como rececionista, ou função de contacto com o cliente; - Forte espírito e orientação para os clientes; - Resiliência e capacidade de resistência ao stress; - Elevada capacidade de relacionamento interpessoal e de trabalho de equipa; - Elevada capacidade de organização e planeamento; - Bons conhecimentos de informática na ótica do utilizador; - Com residência no Porto ou zonas limítrofes. Desafia-nos e faz parte da melhor oferta de marcas e serviços automóveis em Portugal: - Integra um Grupo nacional de referência; - Valoriza o teu talento com formação contínua e possibilidade de progressão;

Localização


Porto, Portugal

Para reforço da equipa de Após-Venda no Porto, terás como principais desafios: - Atendimento e acompanhamento de clientes Após-Venda; - Gestão das entradas na oficina; - Esclarecimento acerca das intervenções auto, dos seus custos e prazos de entrega das viaturas; - Gerir o processo de follow-up e entrega de viaturas junto do cliente; - Realização de tarefas administrativas inerentes à função. Se o teu perfil combina com os nossos requisitos, participa: - Formação ao nível do 12º Ano; - Experiência profissional como rececionista, ou função de contacto com o cliente; - Forte espírito e orientação para os clientes; - Resiliência e capacidade de resistência ao stress; - Elevada capacidade de relacionamento interpessoal e de trabalho de equipa; - Elevada capacidade de organização e planeamento; - Bons conhecimentos de informática na ótica do utilizador; - Com residência no Porto ou zonas limítrofes. Desafia-nos e faz parte da melhor oferta de marcas e serviços automóveis em Portugal: - Integra um Grupo nacional de referência; - Valoriza o teu talento com formação contínua e possibilidade de progressão;

Localização

  • Porto, Portugal

Title: Data Analyst - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Data Analyst to join our team. Your role will be to work across multiple systems to locate, organize, and correlate unstructured data, ensuring it is maintained and presented accurately.

As a Data Analyst, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include

Strategy (non-exhaustive)


Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple systems across 10 countries in the Multilingual Region.
Ensure data consistency and correlation across various dimensions such as but not limited to headcount, languages, verticals, channels, and various other KPIs and benchmarks.
Maintain a structured repository of accurate and up-to-date data for regular access and reporting.
Compare and contrast data from different setups (e.g., B&M vs. WFH) to provide insights into strategy.
Benchmark against industry standards and highlight areas of differentiation.
Analyze pipeline trends and detect discrepancies (e.g., Salesforce data vs. ongoing opportunities).
Perform Lost/Win analyses, deal duration assessments, and revenue impact evaluations.
Provide forecasts and recalculations to reflect pipeline variations and trends accurately.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and narratives that support client proposals and internal strategies.
Create visualizations and summaries that drive understanding and action among diverse stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders across Sales, Solutions, Operations, and other support teams to collect and validate data.
Partner with team members to provide tailored insights and analytics for specific projects or opportunities.
Work closely with the sales and solutions team to ensure that the latest analytics methodologies, case studies, and thinking are being featured in new proposals.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Work closely with internal teams (Reporting, CI, Operations, etc.) to uncover insights and trends.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on the progress and performance of our analytics initiatives and their impact on the business.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have : ‎


Native or proficient level of English (C2) - mandatory
Additional languages are valued
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel - mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Strong analytical and storytelling skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data.
Exceptional organizational skills to manage diverse datasets and ensure consistency.
Ability to work proactively and independently across multiple systems to locate and understand data.
Strong cross-collaboration skills to work effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
Advanced Excel: pivot tables, complex formulas, macros, etc.- mandatory
Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce for pipeline analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint; SharePoint Lists, etc.)
Knowledge of database query languages (e.g., SQL) is a plus.
Exposure to ETL tools/processes is desirable (advanced Excel or scripts like Python or R to mimic ETL processes is a plus).
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work in our Porto Site


Education And Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a sales, operations, or BPO environment.
Experience working with unstructured and multidimensional data sets across different systems
Familiarity with pipeline dynamics and CRM systems (Salesforce experience highly valued).


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever™

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career. 

Apply today!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx) to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation;
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL;
  • +2 years of experience with Alteryx;
  • Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required;
  • Good level of English (mandatory).

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Técnico Suporte De Serviços De Campo (M/F)
Description:
Técnico Suporte de Serviços de Campo (m/f)Na WEG Portugal, somos mais do que uma empresa, somos uma comunidade apaixonada por Motores Elétricos, Automação, Energia e a Indústria global.

Juntos, escrevemos a história da transformação tecnológica, e estamos à procura de mentes criativas para se juntarem à nossa jornada. Se és movido pela excelência, desejas impactar o futuro da energia e valorizas um ambiente de trabalho colaborativo e inclusivo, então esta é a tua oportunidade. Vem fazer parte da nossa equipa na WEG Portugal e junta-te a nós para a construção de um futuro mais inovador, sustentável e eficiente.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area.
Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI
Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions
Good knowledge about SQL.
Good level of English - minimum B2
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / Data Analyst”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

🚀 We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU! ✨

💡 @ KCS IT, we seek those who stand out 🌟, those who always strive to be better 💪 and fight for it 🏆. We value individuals who share our core principles:

🔥 Dedication

⚡ Energy

🤝 Integrity & Transparency

🔄 Flexibility

🛡️ Trust & Honesty

💼 Hard Work & Proactivity

👥 Teamwork

At KCS IT, we champion equality and embrace diversity 🌍🌈. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all!

❌ We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

📩 All applications with relevant skills are welcome! 🚀

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Middle senior

Type of position: Hybrid

The amazing you, will have:

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) for ETL development.
Strong experience with SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) for data modeling.
Hands-on expertise in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for report generation.
Solid experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience in working with large datasets and optimizing queries for performance.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).

Preferred Skills

Experience with Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Reporting & Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Coordinate the data collection, and take in charge data analysis and transformation (ETL), and production of the data necessary for reports.
Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on Cybersecurity processes and data.
Ensure data quality and continuous improvement.
Take in charge some evolution topics.
Ensure the regular production of KPIs (which some of them are shared with the top management).
Ensure the quality of the produced KPIs.
Ensure that KPIs are adequately commented by the right stakeholders.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity or other relevant area for the position.
Very Good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
+3 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power BI is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: RECECIONISTA (M/F)
Description:
Empresa

Inserida no Grupo Serlima, a Serlima Target é a área de negócio cuja especialização é focada em soluções de trabalho temporário e Cedências Diretas.

Descrição

Dado o nosso forte crescimento no mercado, pretendemos reforçar a Serlima Target com a admissão de um RECEPCIONISTA (m/f) para Porto - Realização de check-ins e check-outs; - Atendimento ao cliente presencial e telefónico; - Inserção e verificação de reservas; - Serviço de Concierge e informações turísticas; - Outras funções inerentes ao serviço de receção.

Requisitos


Minímo12º ano; - Experiência na função; - Forte capacidade de trabalho em equipa; - Orientação para o cliente; - Domínio da língua inglesa (falado e escrito); - Conhecimentos de informática; - Flexibilidade de horários; - Disponibilidade imediata.


Oferta


Contrato de trabalho e remuneração de acordo a função e á experiência; - Inclusão em equipa jovem e dinâmica; - Formação contínua Envia-nos o teu CV para: target.recrutamento.hot@serlima.pt

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for an Data & Reporting Analyst!




Requirements:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.
Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high-quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability.
Rigorous.
Client oriented.
Collaborative working skills.
Adaptation capacity.
Analytical skills.
Very Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/Data&Reporting”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

Join the Data Sourcing Accounting Data team, within the Financial Data Integrity (FDI) division at Natixis, as part of the Finance Direction dedicated to upholding the integrity and accuracy of financial data across CIB activities (balance sheet and off-balance sheet). Our team is split between Paris and Porto, part of a department, of around 150 professionals, and is on the frontline of labelling financial data for both balance sheet and off-balance sheet activities.

Data Sourcing is split between Paris and Porto, and you'll be an integral part of a 10-member team.

You will be part of an integral part of a 10-member bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris.

As a Data Analyst, for of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:

  • Support Data quality initiatives to meet both internal standards and regulatory requirements, with a particular focus on ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of Critical Data Elements (CDEs). These efforts are crucial for enhancing the integrity of financial reporting and analysis across the institution.
  • Engaging in comprehensive data monitoring activities for Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) sectors, including Financing and Global Markets. Your analysis will support data-driven decision-making and operational excellence in these key areas.

You will be in contact with the Operations department (middle and back offices), the other teams of FDI & the internal Finance partners, and Finance IT teams.

Functions:

Monitoring and analysing data at the granular level to ensure the quality of the data required for all financial reporting or indicators (ALM, Solvency, Liquidity, FINREP,…):

  • Set up meetings with final internal partners to do a post-mortem of quarterly closing;
  • Study and propose new controls to be implemented or to evolve existing controls (especially completeness, existence, accuracy, consistency, or freshness controls):
  • Analyze the needs of the final internal partners;
  • Perform database queries to study the relevance of results;
  • Test and launch in production new controls.
  • Controlling the data acquisition & treatment on the financial chain inputs, along the flow;
  • Detecting anomalies & analyzing the root causes;
  • Reporting and alerting the management and the internal partners (accounting and ratio teams);
  • Defining remedial short and long term actions;
  • Writing and updating of operational procedures;
  • Support the data sourcing activities.

As a Data Analyst, you will be integral in ensuring the quality and integrity of data across all levels, crucial for financial reporting and compliance with indicators such as ALM, Solvency, Liquidity, and FINREP. Your responsibilities include:

  • Post-Mortem Meetings: Organize debrief sessions with key internal stakeholders after quarterly closings to review outcomes and identify improvement areas:
  • Control Evolution and Implementation:
  • Collaborate with internal partners to understand their data requirements and challenges;
  • Conduct database queries to assess the relevance of data and identify gaps, particularly focusing on Critical Data Elements (CDEs) to ensure their accuracy and completeness;
  • Develop, test, and deploy new controls or refine existing ones to enhance data completeness, existence, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness;
  • Data Acquisition & Treatment: Oversee the data collection and processing stages within the financial chain, ensuring smooth and error-free data flow.
  • Anomaly Detection: Proactively identify data discrepancies, delve into their root causes, and communicate findings with relevant teams, emphasizing the importance of managing CDEs effectively;
  • Communication: Report findings, anomalies, and recommendations to management and internal partners (accounting and ratio teams), fostering a culture of transparency and continuous improvement;
  • Action Planning: Develop both immediate and long-term remediation plans to address identified issues, ensuring the robustness of financial data;
  • Operational Documentation: Regularly review and update operational procedures to reflect current best practices and data management strategies;
  • Data Sourcing Support: Play a key role in assisting the Data Sourcing teams by:
  • Implementing automation strategies to streamline data retrieval and analysis processes.
  • Enhancing the efficiency and reliability of data sourcing activities, ensuring high-quality data is available for decision-making and reporting.

Additional information:

  • You will be part of a bi-localised team with a local manager and a functional manager Paris based, with regular interactions Paris team;
  • The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

  • Strong Background/Education in a quantitative discipline, with a professional experience as a Data or Business Analyst, preferably in the finance department of a mid / large cap company or audit;
  • Data or Business Analyst (notions);
  • Financial Products (advanced knowledge);
  • Data Viz & Data Prep Tools (Power BI, Tableau, Quicksight, Google Analytics, ...) (advanced knowledge);
  • Python (advanced knowledge);
  • SQL (advanced knowledge);
  • Microsoft Office (Excel, VBA, PowerPoint,…) (advanced knowledge);
  • Project Management (advanced knowledge);
  • Other Programming Languages (notions);
  • Fluent English and Good Level of French (a big plus).

Soft Skills:

  • Rigor and accuracy;
  • Ability to analyse, summarise and report;
  • Critical thinking, flexible and problem solving;
  • Personal commitment and team spirit;
  • Autonomy, curiosity, and willingness to move the issues forward.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Op. Posto de Abastecimento | Maia (Via Diagonal)
HTML:
A PRIO está a recrutar um(a) profissional para integrar a nossa equipa do posto de abastecimento da PRIO da Maia Via Diagonal (Substituição de férias). A PRIO é a maior produtora de biocombustíveis nacional, opera e abastece uma rede de mais de 300 estações de serviço de norte a sul de Portugal.

O Que Faz Um Operador De Posto De Abastecimento

  • Caixa e atendimento ao cliente;
  • Reposição de stocks na loja;

  • Participação em team buildings e outros eventos;

  • Prémios variáveis, entre outras regalias.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world’s best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

OPERATIONS

We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO

Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE

We are looking for an Operations Business Analyst to run end-to-end operational performance, identifying key trends and supporting decision-making through data-driven analysis and actionable recommendations. This role will play a critical part in monitoring, analyzing, and improving operational efficiency and customer experience across our services.

What You'll Do


Oversee end-to-end performance of all operational services, collaborating cross-functionally with Operations and Finance to run Weekly and Monthly Business Reviews, ensuring key stakeholders are aligned on insights and priorities
Investigate root causes behind performance trends and anomalies, going beyond surface-level data into comprehensive variance analysis. Present findings in a clear, actionable manner with data-driven recommendations to enhance efficiency, service levels, and customer experience
Design and manage dashboards and reports using data visualization tools (e.g., Looker), ensuring data governance and quality across teams to provide accurate and meaningful insights
Develop and spread new metrics that align with business targets, continuously refining how we evaluate order and operational service performance
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to inform strategic initiatives and run the yearly service targets set up, assisting Operations leaders during the process and establishing performance benchmarks





Who You Are


University degree must include a strong analytical focus. The successful candidate will likely have a degree in economics, maths, management, engineering or any other related field
Minimum 4 years’ experience as data or business analyst
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau), SQL/Big Query and excel
Clear communicator, with the ability to turn numbers into a story that non-experts can understand
Strong analytical skills, data-based decision-making and detail-oriented
Dynamic, with a high sense of responsibility and a problem-solver
Fluency in English is mandatory, both written and spoken.





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


FARFETCH is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process

Title: Técnico de Bilheteira e Despachos (m/f) - Campanhã (Expressos)
HTML:
Quem somos nós?

Somos uma das maiores referências no transporte público de passageiros a nível mundial, desenvolvendo em Portugal soluções de mobilidade inovadoras nos setores rodoviário e fluvial. A equipa conta com mais de 1900 trabalhadores, todos orientados pelos mesmos valores: segurança, desempenho, paixão, parcerias e compromisso.

Se partilha dos nossos valores, junte-se à equipa!

Como será o seu dia a dia?

  • Efetuar a venda de títulos de transporte e a marcação de lugares:
  • Controlar a existência de títulos evitando a rutura de stocks;
  • Proceder à entrega dos valores e documentos referentes às transações efetuadas;
  • Prestar informações aos clientes e ao público em geral;
  • Verificar e assegurar as boas condições de utilização e funcionamento dos equipamentos e serviços da empresa, na sua área de intervenção, em temos de segurança, conforto e qualidade;
  • Atender pedidos e reclamações dos clientes;
  • Efetuar a receção de mercadorias e proceder ao seu despacho ou entrega ao cliente;
  • Efetuar a conferência de mercadorias ou despachos fazendo ainda a sua pesagem, quando necessário, zelando pela conservação e armazenamento das mesmas;
  • Elaborar mapas e controlar todos os fluxos associados aos despachos efetuados e recebidos;
  • Cumprir com a política da qualidade, ambiente e segurança da empresa.

Requisitos

  • Habilitações ao nível do 12.º ano de escolaridade;
  • Bons conhecimentos de informática;
  • Dinamismo e ambição;
  • Gosto pelo contacto com pessoal e relações interpessoais;
  • Implicação no dia-a-dia da empresa;
  • Disponibilidade para trabalhar em regime de horário rotativo e aos fins-de-semana.

Benefícios

  • Contrato sem termo;
  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Descontos em diversas empresas parceiras;
  • Formação ao longo da carreira;
  • Possibilidade de um percurso de carreira nacional e internacional.

Title: Support ERP | Porto
HTML:
A Pinto & Cruz Gestão, empresa do Grupo Pinto & Cruz, de serviços partilhados, Atualmente, estamos a contratar um/a Support ERP para integrar a nossa equipa na nossa sede no Porto.

FUNÇÃO

Terás como principais responsabilidades:

  • Suporte técnico e funcional para utilizadores de ERP;
  • Diagnóstico e resolução de problemas inerentes ao sistema ERP;
  • Configuração e personalização de módulos do sistema ERP, de acordo com as necessidades das empresas do grupo;
  • Colaboração com parceiros de forma a solucionar problemas complexos;
  • Formação a utilizadores acerca do uso adequado do sistema ERP;
  • Registo de problemas recorrentes e sugestão de melhorias;
  • Realização de testes das novas funcionalidades e atualizações do ERP antes da sua implementação;
  • Garantia da integridade, da segurança e da proteção dos dados internos do sistema ERP.


PERFILÉs responsável e proativo/a? Tens espírito crítico e facilidade de comunicação e argumentação? Gostas de trabalhar em equipa? És organizado/a e com capacidade de planeamento? Então temos uma oportunidade para ti!

  • Formação em Tecnologia da Informação ou similar (obrigatório);
  • Conhecimentos de processos empresariais e fluxos de trabalho (obrigatório);
  • Experiência com configurações e personalizações de módulos ERP (obrigatório);
  • Competências para realização de diagnósticos e solução de problemas técnicos;
  • Conhecimentos de bases de dados e linguagens de consulta SQL (preferencial);
  • Experiência em suporte de sistemas ERP, preferencialmente ERP Primavera;
  • Experiência em programação (preferencial).


CONDIÇÕES

  • Remuneração de acordo com a experiência e conhecimentos demonstrados;
  • Pacote de compensações;
  • Possibilidade de trabalho remoto a médio prazo;
  • Horário: segunda-feira a sexta-feira das 8h45 às 12h30 e das 13h45 às 18h00);
  • Integração em equipa com um ambiente colaborativo e criativo;
  • Integração num grupo empresarial sólido e prestigiado;
  • Oportunidades de desenvolvimento pessoal e formação na área de atuação.


Estás interessado/a? Então não percas tempo! Envia-nos o teu currículo e vem fazer parte da nossa equipa!

Title: Guia Turístico
HTML:
A Synchro by EGOR, na área de Outsourcing, recruta Guia Turístico para prestigiada entidade cultural, localizada no Porto.

FUNÇÃO

  • Realização de visitas guiadas em português e inglês;
  • Acompanhamento dos visitantes;
  • Fornecer informações detalhadas e interessantes sobre os pontos visitados;
  • Interagir com os turistas, respondendo a perguntas e fornecendo assistência conforme necessário;
  • Adaptar o roteiro conforme o interesse e as necessidades do grupo.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Porto;
  • Horários:
    • Quarta-feira das 10h-12h;
    • Sexta-feira das 16h-18h;
    • Sábado 10h-12h.
REQUISITOS

  • Habilitações ao nível do 12.º ano de escolaridade ou Curso técnico-profissional ou licenciatura na área de Turismo, História, Gestão do Património ou equivalente;
  • Experiência anterior da função;
  • Domínio da língua inglesa (fator obrigatório);
  • Boa comunicação, proatividade e sentido de responsabilidade;
  • Ser entusiasmado, comunicativo e capaz de fornecer um serviço excecional aos turistas, garantindo uma experiência rica e envolvente.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Prestação de serviços com valor de 15.00/h;
  • O pagamento poderá ser através de um Recibo Verde ou Ato Isolado;
  • Ambiente de trabalho dinâmico e colaborativo.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

Synchro by EGOR – Outsourcing Porto

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados no prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis

Title: Técnico/A De Gestão De Projetos Para Integrar A Equipa Do Research Innovation Office
Company: Universidade Católica Portuguesa - Centro Regional do Porto
Description:
Principais atividades: Acompanhar a contratualização do financiamento atribuído a projetos e a sua execução nas componentes administrativa e financeira, em articulação com as partes envolvidas, devendo nomeadamente:

Ajustar a análise ao cumprimento dos objetivos de viabilidade financeira definidos;Centralizar e coordenar o processo de formalização da concessão da comparticipação financeira aprovada;Informar o Coordenador Interno e outros intervenientes relevantes das normas de execução associadas ao financiamento;Criar e manter o dossier de projeto, nos termos estipulados pelas entidades financiadoras;Acompanhar e controlar a execução orçamental do projeto, visando garantir a realização da despesa em conformidade com as normas de elegibilidade estabelecidas;Controlar as verbas recebidas ou a receber no âmbito do projeto;Elaborar e entregar relatórios e pedidos de pagamento intercalares e finais do projeto;Centralizar a comunicação com as entidades financiadoras e outros intervenientes envolvidos, garantindo a prestação de eventuais esclarecimentos por estes solicitados;Gerir ou participar na gestão de alguns processos administrativos específicos relevantes à execução de projetos financiados;Preparar e acompanhar auditorias aos projetos.Requisitos: Formação superior em Ciências Empresariais (Economia/gestão, Contabilidade e afins);Experiência mínima de 3 anos em acompanhamento de projetos financiados;Bons conhecimentos de informática (especialmente MSExcel e MSWord);Experiência na utilização de software de contabilidade;Bom nível de inglês;Boa capacidade de comunicação e de relacionamento interpessoal;Elevado grau de rigor e sentido de responsabilidade.Métodos de seleção: Análise curricular;Entrevistas de seleção aos candidatos melhor posicionados, conforme necessário.Prazo e forma de apresentação das candidaturas: Deverá formalizar a candidatura com o envio do curriculum vitae, certificado(s) de habilitações e carta de motivação no seguinte formulário:

https://hr-ucpporto.inqueritos.porto.ucp.pt/227613?lang=en

A candidatura deverá ser submetida até ao dia 20 de abril de 2025. Só serão avaliadas as candidaturas que sejam apresentadas nos termos aqui definidos.

Contactos para esclarecimentos: Direção de Recursos Humanos UCP CRP

Tel.: +351 226196239

Empresa

Descrição da Oferta: Inserida no Grupo Serlima, a Serlima Target é a área de negócio cuja especialização é focada em soluções de trabalho temporário e Cedências Diretas, funcionando tanto como suporte das operações como das restantes empresas do Grupo. Sob o lema "Facultamos o profissional certo!" estamos a recrutar um/(a) Assistente de Apoio ao Cliente (M/F) INBOUND para empresa cliente na zona de Alverca.

Descrição

Comunicação com clientes e fornecedores através de email e telefone; Receção, registo e gestão de reclamações; Tratamento das encomendas; Controlo de encomendas em trânsito e pendentes.

Requisitos

Escolaridade ao nível do 12º ano; Conhecimentos sólidos em Inglês e Espanhol (Obrigatório); Experiência no atendimento ao cliente; Excelente capacidade de comunicação; Disponibilidade total e imediata.

Oferta

Remuneração compatível com a experiência; Bom ambiente de trabalho. Caso tenha interesse nesta vaga, envie o seu CV para o seguinte e-mail: ******

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project in Porto (twice a week in the office).




Requirements:

• 6 to 9 years' experience

• Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM)

• Ability to write specifications and documentation

• Expertise in Oracle and SQL language

• Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI

• Advanced knowledge of DAX

• Fluent in English (both written and verbal) (mandatory)

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI) – All genders - Oporto – Open Ended Contract – Hybrid
Description:
WHO ARE WE ?

BNP PARIBAS CARDIF, the Insurer for a Changing World.

We are the world leader in the creditor insurance market with strong positions in savings and protection insurance in more than 30 countries all around the world.

European Service Center - Cardif Services, European Platform of Services with a diversity of processes aiming to bring excellence to our Internal Clients, being part of BNP Paribas Cardif, is an organization dedicated to providing other BNP Paribas Cardif entities with a diversity of processes and services connected to insurance activity. We aim to bring excellence to our internal clients, ensuring highest levels of efficiency and reliability. With over 480 employees and 6 working languages, we are a multicultural and a diverse team, operating in Porto and Lisbon, Portugal.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst (M/F) based in Oporto

BE PART OF OUR DYNAMIC RSBI TEAM

As a Technical expert / administrator of Data Visualization et Data Preparation solution, you will have to ensure the functioning of existing Dashboards (based on DataViz solutions) et Data preparation tools, and develop new ones for Finance and Actuarial needs

YOUR FUTURE MISSION IN RSBI TEAM


Create and maintain DataPrep wokflow / tools (Alteryx / Dataiku)
Modeling and development of dashboards within PowerBi and Tableau technologies
Write functional and/or technical documentation and create POCs (Proof Of Concept)
Ensure diagnostics and resolution of malfunctions
Participate to the implementation process improvements
Manipulate data to facilitate decisions by Finance teams


As Our New Accounting Analyst, You Must Have


Information systems background
Professional background about 2/3 years in a similar position
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling
Data Preparation workflow modeling (Dataiku and Alteryx)
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling (DMC)
Data Visualization / Restitution tools (mainly Tableau and Power BI)
Be fluent in English (B2/C1 level) and French is a plus


What Do We Offer

Besides our attractive salary, you will benefit :


Meals allowance
Transportation allowance
Child allowance
Private Health Insurance including spouse and descendants, Life Insurance, Travel Insurance
Hybrid working mode – a balance between office days to reinforce commitment, creativity and human links, and homeworking days for flexibility of the employees
Continuous development and career growth opportunities on a local and global level
And much more…


The work environment is important!


Benefit from our modern amenities, including zen and creative rooms amongst others, many discounts from our group platform, free language courses, doctor on-site & remote and diverse company events,
Work in a multicultural environment with multiple nationalities,
Be part of a people care company with a strong & continuous growth investing in its employees through training and career opportunities.


Our commitments to you


Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas Cardif is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas Cardif we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas Cardif, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment.

If your profile and motivations matches our needs and you feel motivated to join our company, do not hesitate in sending us you application.

We will be delighted to consider you for this position.

Please note that only applications submitted with CV, Cover letter & Certificate of Studies will be considered and move forward in the application process.

Title: Técnico de Sistemas Junior
HTML:
A Proxsys Solutions é uma empresa integradora de soluções tecnológicas, com vasta experiência na área de sistemas de informação.

Fundada em 2018, a Proxsys apresenta-se como uma empresa especializada na prestação de serviços TI.

Contando com uma equipa de proﬁssionais certiﬁcados e qualiﬁcados, a Proxsys realiza projetos de consultoria, assessoria, planeamento, implementação e administração de sistemas de informação, tendo em conta as reais necessidades do cliente, desenvolvendo assim soluções à medida que permitem rentabilizar os investimentos realizados.

Descrição Da Função

  • Técnico de sistemas junior

Perfil

  • Licenciatura ou formação certificada na área de sistemas de informação;
  • Administração Sistemas Microsoft (Windows Server 2016, 2019,2022);
  • Conhecimentos nas seguintes áreas:
    • Soluções de e-mail;
    • Administração de Active Directory;
    • Soluções de virtualização;
    • Sistemas operativos Linux (CentOS, Debian, Ubuntu);
    • Soluções de backup;
    • Redes, comunicações e segurança;
  • Facilidade na utilização de ferramentas de monitorização;
  • Capacidade de análise e resolução de problemas;
  • Capacidade de estabelecer boas relações interpessoais e de integração em equipa;
  • Capacidade de comunicação com os utilizadores dos sistemas;
  • Capacidade de aprendizagem continua;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autónoma e com sentido crítico;
  • Carta de condução;
  • Fluente nas seguintes línguas:
    • Inglês – Falado e escrito
    • Português – Falado e escrito
Oferecemos

  • Pacote salarial de acordo as competências reveladas;
  • Oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional;

Localização

  • Porto

Envia-nos a tua candidatura, preferencialmente em formato europeu, para .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area.
Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI
Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions
Good knowledge about SQL.
Good level of English - minimum B2
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / Data Analyst”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

🚀 We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU! ✨

💡 @ KCS IT, we seek those who stand out 🌟, those who always strive to be better 💪 and fight for it 🏆. We value individuals who share our core principles:

🔥 Dedication

⚡ Energy

🤝 Integrity & Transparency

🔄 Flexibility

🛡️ Trust & Honesty

💼 Hard Work & Proactivity

👥 Teamwork

At KCS IT, we champion equality and embrace diversity 🌍🌈. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all!

❌ We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

📩 All applications with relevant skills are welcome! 🚀

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Middle senior

Type of position: Hybrid

The amazing you, will have:

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) for ETL development.
Strong experience with SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) for data modeling.
Hands-on expertise in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for report generation.
Solid experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience in working with large datasets and optimizing queries for performance.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).

Preferred Skills

Experience with Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

🔥 Dedication

🤝 Integrity & Transparency

🔄 Flexibility

🛡️ Trust & Honesty

💼 Hard Work & Proactivity

👥 Teamwork

At KCS IT, we champion equality and embrace diversity 🌍🌈. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all!

❌ We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

📩 All applications with relevant skills are welcome! 🚀

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Middle senior

Type of position: Hybrid

The amazing you, will have:

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) for ETL development.
  • Strong experience with SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) for data modeling.
  • Hands-on expertise in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for report generation.
  • Solid experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
  • Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
  • Experience in working with large datasets and optimizing queries for performance.
  • Fluent in English (both written and spoken).

Preferred Skills

  • Experience with Power BI or other data visualization tools.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
  • Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.
  • Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.


Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Reporting & Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data & Reporting Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Coordinate the data collection, and take in charge data analysis and transformation (ETL), and production of the data necessary for reports.
Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on Cybersecurity processes and data.
Ensure data quality and continuous improvement.
Take in charge some evolution topics.
Ensure the regular production of KPIs (which some of them are shared with the top management).
Ensure the quality of the produced KPIs.
Ensure that KPIs are adequately commented by the right stakeholders.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity or other relevant area for the position.
Very Good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
+3 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power BI is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability




📍 Hybrid role based in Porto.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!
